name: Beaverton Library
description: Twelve-stop quest around the Beaverton Library and City Park area.

checkpoints.name: Give Me the News
checkpoints.clue: Stories once lived inside this chest—find the box where news used to rest.

checkpoints.name: I Have No Clue
checkpoints.clue: Twisting shapes reach for the sky, a magical tower catches your eye.

checkpoints.name: Our City
checkpoints.clue: Remember this city and you will see, a toothy mascot dressed for the sea.

checkpoints.name: It is the Answer
checkpoints.clue: A crimson key unlocks the way, where treasure is guarded every day.

checkpoints.name: The King
checkpoints.clue: The king of beasts takes a nap above—raise your chin to find this cub.

checkpoints.name: Remember the Sub
checkpoints.clue: Silent and sleek beneath the sea, I was built to strike unseen.
checkpoints.funFact: Did you know that torpedoes like this one were once nicknamed "fish" by submariners? The sleek design and propeller-like tail earned them the comparison. This particular memorial isn't just about the weapon—it also honors the crews of submarines, known for their silent and dangerous missions beneath the waves.

checkpoints.name: A Relic
checkpoints.clue: Rolling on two wheels but never to roam, this iron guard stands frozen, protecting its home.
checkpoints.funFact: This green relic is a World War II–era artillery piece, often called a "field gun." These mobile cannons were towed behind trucks or jeeps and could be quickly set up to defend towns, bridges, or camps. Despite looking heavy and immovable, soldiers could actually roll them into position using just their strength and teamwork. Today, many communities display retired cannons like this one as memorials to honor local veterans.

checkpoints.name: Fishes
checkpoints.clue: Knock if you dare — two fishes that stare.

checkpoints.name: Garden Watcher
checkpoints.clue: Peaceful and still, with beads in hand, I watch the garden where you stand.

checkpoints.name: A Tree
checkpoints.clue: Not on the beach, yet still I sway—wrapped in lights for night and day.

checkpoints.name: A Place for All
checkpoints.clue: A thousand faces form just one—beneath a cross, all are welcome.
